spx.graphics

Class RadarDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • spx.graphics.RadarDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class RadarDisplay
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    RadarDisplay class for displaying radar in a Java component received using the external compositing mode of the RDC. This class is only supported on 32-bit or 64-bit Windows. On any other system, attempting to use this class will cause an UnsupportedOperationException.
    See Also:
    UnsupportedOperationException, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • RadarDisplay

        public RadarDisplay()
        Creates a RadarDisplay object. The setBitmapName function must be called to create the underlying shared bitmap that the RDC can output to.
        See Also:
        setBitmapName(java.lang.String)

    • Method Detail

      • getLatestBitmapData

        protected void getLatestBitmapData()
        Updates the internal BufferedImage with the latest radar data. To override the default paint behaviour: 1. Override the paintComponent() function. 2. Call this function from the overridden paintComponent() function. 3. Retrieve the BufferedImage with the latest radar image using the getImage() function. 4. Perform any required custom rendering. The BufferedImage will be in 32-bit ARGB format with dimensions based on the screen size. The top left portion of the BufferedImage will be in use at any time (based on this component size). The same BufferedImage persists for the lifetime of this component.
        See Also:
        getImage(), paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics)

      • getImage

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        Retrieve the internal BufferedImage used for radar rendering.
        Returns:
        Radar image
        See Also:
        getLatestBitmapData()

      • setBitmapName

        public void setBitmapName(java.lang.String bitmapName)
        Sets the name of the shared memory bitmap that this class will create, and the RDC will write the radar video to. Any existing shared memory bitmap will be destroyed.
        Parameters:
        bitmapName - New shared bitmap name.

      • getBitmapName

        public java.lang.String getBitmapName()
        Gets the current name of the shared memory bitmap. Use the getFullBitmapName function to get the bitmap name to use when associating the shared memory bitmap with RDC.
        Returns:
        The shared memory bitmap name or null.
        See Also:
        getFullBitmapName()

      • getFullBitmapName

        public java.lang.String getFullBitmapName()
        Get the full bitmap name to use when associating the shared memory bitmap with the RDC.
        Returns:
        Full bitmap name.
